Text: RE Comments Cc playing hardtoget believe me When I didnt get an immediate response from you last week I revived a couple of other pending projects and Im trying to find natural break points in them to come back to this ISDA I am out most of the day My docket is cluttered with minutia I will need a couple of hours to reacquaint myself with the ISDA issues but I am anxious to get through this thing as is IPPI Early next week would be best for me Of course we dont have to tackle all the issues at one time And I personally prefer a WRITTEN dialogue for auditrail purposes but I can work in a verbal format if it suits you better All I ask is that the protagonists will have read and thought through my comments and questions BEFORE the call Thanx JFalconi Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday May AM To Cc Subject RE Comments Jack We have located your Fed Ex sorry for the confusion I have skimmed through your comments Looks like most of them are creditrelated Could we schedule a call with the lawyers and credit folks to wrap this up and then you and I can discuss remaining legal issues Let me know what you think as well as times that would be good for you and your folks I would guess that we need about hours Carol St Clair EB Phone Fax Falconi Jack TIFS Jack uaranty To Falconi Jack TIFS groupcom cc AM Subject RE Comments I fedexed my comments to Susan Bailey for receipt and I notified you of this in an email sent on Let me know if it did not arrive Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday May AM To Cc Subject Comments Jack Did you send over your comments I have not received anything by fax or messenger and our business folks are anxious to move this forward Please let me know where things stand Thanks Carol St Clair EB Phone Fax

RE MeetingCarol Sorry for the delay The credit person at Inland is probably Julie Beck although she can naturally be overruled by the TempleInland Treasurer Dave Turpin or CFO Randy Levy since TempleInland will be obtaining the letter of credit and will serve as guarantor Since they are at least one step removed from the process if you could tell me what questionscomments from my memo they will need to address and ideally your responsescommentary in some summary format I can upstream this information to them obtain their feedback and speak on their behalf Thanx Jack Falconi Original Message From mailto Sent Thursday May PM To Subject Meeting Jack My assistant will be calling you to set up a time next week when Ken Curry and I can discuss your comments with you and your credit person Her name is Suzanne Adams Carol St Clair EB Phone Fax

RE Meeting Cc Carol I will work on these while I await your open issues list Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday May PM To Cc Subject RE Meeting Jack I will send you an open issues list shortly I considered items and to be creditrelated comments some of which I need my credit persons input on As to the remaining points here is my response Lets discuss exactly what language you want in item as I agree with you on the concept With respect to item your interpretation is correct I am not clear on what your point is in items and As a general rule with respect to setoff rights to the extent that ENA is the NonDefaulting Party and ENAs affiliates have entered into other agreements with Inland Paperboard and Packaging amounts owed under those affiliate agreements can be setoff against amounts owed under the ISDA All the guaranty is trying to say is that the amount guaranteed under the Guaranty takes into account the exercise of such setoff rights Im not sure I understand your point I agree with your point With respect to point collateral is limited to cash and LCs and the concept of a custodial account applies when someone other than the Secured Party is holding the cash collateral With respect to point we want the ability to convert the LC into cash collateral when an Event of Default occurs even if we have not yet terminated all transactions Once we have terminated and established a termination amount we would only draw to cover that amount if we didnt draw earlier The deemed occurrence language is meant to cover termination events that occur automatically without either party electing to terminate such as in a bankruptcy scenario where automatic early termination is elected We could probably take it out since there is no automatic early termination on bankruptcy I look forward to hearing from you My credit person is out this week but maybe you and I can make some progress Carol St Clair EB Phone Fax Falconi Jack TIFS Jack uaranty To groupcom cc Subject RE Meeting AM Hi Carol Sorry for the delay The credit person at Inland is probably Julie Beck although she can naturally be overruled by the TempleInland Treasurer Dave Turpin or CFO Randy Levy since TempleInland will be obtaining the letter of credit and will serve as guarantor Since they are at least one step removed from the process if you could tell me what questionscomments from my memo they will need to address and ideally your responsescommentary in some summary format I can upstream this information to them obtain their feedback and speak on their behalf Thanx Jack Falconi Original Message From mailto Sent Thursday May PM To Subject Meeting Jack My assistant will be calling you to set up a time next week when Ken Curry and I can discuss your comments with you and your credit person Her name is Suzanne Adams Carol St Clair EB Phone Fax
IPPI ISDA Response To EMail Cc receipt Thanx IPPIISDAdoc IPPIISDAdoc

RE Status Cc Attached are my responses to your email sent If your could consider these responses and integrate them into your redraft We can set up a conference call once we have an estimated arrival time for the redraft Thanx for your responses Please acknowledge receipt JFalconi Original Message From mailto Sent Thursday June AM To Cc Subject Status Jack Jim Crump met with Mike Sullivan and Julie Beck yesterday and it appears as if based on the emails that we have exchanged that the next step is to have a conference call to finalize the ISDA and the remaining open issues What I plan to do by tomorrow is circulate a redraft of the Schedules Julie and Mike agreed that David Turpin should partic ipate in the call so that all open issues can be resolved Could you please contact my assistant Suzanne Adams at and give her some days and times next week that you and David are available I would think that we would only need an hour I plan to have Ken Curry my credit person with me for the call Thanks Carol St Clair EB Phone Fax IPPIISDAdoc
